name: BillingCycleInstance
comment: Maintains valid bill cycle period values for which charges are calculated and bills are generated. Bill cycle is created based on the cycle code definitions, which includes the cycle close day. The cycle close day is used to determine the specific cycle start and the end date for a given month and year. This entity also maintains the cycle status and other flags used for controlling invoicing flows during billing run.
vf short description: Maintains valid bill cycle period values for which charges are calculated and bills are generated. Bill cycle is created based on the cycle code definitions, which includes the cycle close day.

fields.name: BillingCycleInstanceSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ValidFromDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity begin in EDWH

fields.name: ValidUntilDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity end in EDWH

fields.name: KeyTypeId
fields.comment: Key type of record

fields.name: BillingCycleInstanceKey
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the billing cycle instance in ALDM. Each billing cycle value instance represents a unique billing cycle instance. BL1_CYCLE_CONTROL.CYCLE_SEQ_NO//Generated Key on Cycle Seq Source Id

fields.name: BillingCycleSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: CycleSeqSourceId
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the billing cycle instances in the source system. BL1_CYCLE_CONTROL.CYCLE_SEQ_NO

fields.name: CycleInstance
fields.comment: Identifies the cycle instance in a calendar year. The cycle instance has the following interpretations according to the cycle frequency: - Weekly - Week number during the year. This number can be anything between 1 and 52.Note: Because January 1 can fall in the middle of a week, there can be some confusion on what should be considered to be the first week of the year. The weekly cycle instance 1 is defined as the first full week of the calendar year. - Multi weekly - For bi-weekly cycles, this number can be between 1 and 26. - Monthly - Month of the year. - Multi monthly - For quarterly cycles, a number between 1 and 4. //CES:BL1_CYCLE_CONTROL.CYCLE_INSTANCE//Optima:select TO_CHAR(BILL_CYCLE.prep_date, MM ) from BILL_CYCLE

fields.name: CycleYear
fields.comment: Indicates the year of the cycle end date. //CES:BL1_CYCLE_CONTROL.CYCLE_YEAR//Optima:select TO_CHAR(BILL_CYCLE.prep_date, YYYY ) from BILL_CYCLE

fields.name: StartDate
fields.comment: //CES:Indicates the start date of the billing cycle.//Optima:Statement date to print on the bill for this cycle. //CES:BL1_CYCLE_CONTROL.START_DATE//Optima:BILL_CYCLE.STATEMENT_DATE

fields.name: EndDate
fields.comment: Specifies the end date of the billing cycle. //CES:BL1_CYCLE_CONTROL.END_DATE//Optima:BILL_CYCLE. CUTOFF_DATE

fields.name: RunDate
fields.comment: Describes the billing cycle. //CES:BL1_CYCLE_CONTROL.RUN_DATE//Optima:BILL_CYCLE. PPDD_DATE

fields.name: StatusInd
fields.comment: Specifies the billing cycle status. Values are:- CL=CLOSED - CN=CONFIRMED - CR=CHANGE_CYCLE_RUNING - LC=LOCK_REQUEST - PN=PENDING - PR=PROCESSED-WITH-REJECTS - PS=PROCESSED - RJ=REJECT - RN=RUNNING BL1_CYCLE_CONTROL.STATUS

fields.name: BssCreationDate
fields.comment: Date stamp when record was created in source. BL1_CYCLE_CONTROL.SYS_CREATION_DATE

fields.name: BssModificationDate
fields.comment: Last update timestamp of the record in source. BL1_CYCLE_CONTROL.SYS_UPDATE_DATE

fields.name: BillingCycleId
fields.comment: Unique identifier of the billing cycle in the source system. //Optima:Fetch Billing Cycle Id from Billing Cycle based on BILL_CYCLE. BILL_PERIOD=Billing Cycle.Billing Cycle Id

fields.name: DelayHours
fields.comment: Indicates number of hours BIP delays after cutoff time before processinginvoices for this cycle. Used to ensure that all usage for the cycleis able to be processed. //Optima:BILL_CYCLE.PREP_DELAY

fields.name: ModifiedRunDate
fields.comment: Modified cutoff date, calculated by: cuttoff_date + (prep_delay/24). //Optima:BILL_CYCLE.PREP_DELAY

fields.name: BillingFrequency
fields.comment: 1	Daily2	Weekly3	Monthly4	Quarterly6	Yearly7	Bi-monthly8	Quarterly9	Semi-annually //Optima:BILL_CYCLE.BILLING_FREQUENCY

fields.name: PaymentDueDate
fields.comment: Date on which the payment is due for this cycle. Last day to pay the bill (the date is higher than cutoff_date) BILL_CYCLE.PPDD_DATE

fields.name: NextPaymentDueDate
fields.comment: Date on which payment is due for the following cycle. BILL_CYCLE.NEXT_PPDD_DATE

fields.name: SourceSystemId
fields.comment: Represents the code of the source system that the leading entity of the current target is coming from. It is suffix also include the code of the DB instance on that system such that in case of multiple instances of the same source system are deployed (Scalability) it will be possible to trace the target to it is source system instance

fields.name: DeleteIndicator
fields.comment: Set to True when the leading source entity of this target entity was deleted in the source system

fields.name: RowUpdateTime
fields.comment: The time stamp when the row was written to the Target real-time/staging storage

fields.name: SourceUpdateTime
fields.comment: The latest create/update timestamp of any of the entities composing this target entity

fields.name: SourceQueryTime
fields.comment: The timestamp of reading the data from source system. - when using CDC it is usually similar to the latest update, in SQL cases it is the time of running the SQL. When a dummy target entity is created as a temporary entity to maintain referential integrity this indicator will be set to True. As soon as the real target entity is stored it will be stored with False dummy indicator value.

fields.name: DptiId
fields.comment: Counter which represents the cycle number of the job	is_deleted	boolean	is_deleted	Represents if the record is deleted. Is been updated after the compaction job

fields.name: PTime
fields.comment: Partition time based on the event time for target entities marked to be partitioned event time rounded the correct partition window (hourly, daily etc..)

fields.name: Insert_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which inserted the record in the table

fields.name: Update_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which updated the record in the table
